website_summaries.verdict: While it's a handsome, value-priced option, others on our list have more to offer when it comes to reliable connectivity.
pros: Sports convenient preset buttons and easy-to-read digital screen
Has a lightweight design and is on the lower end of the price spectrum
cons: WiFi connectivity can be unreliable, and it's difficult to sync with some Bluetooth devices

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money On This Wifi Radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wifi radio a few years ago to get radio stations from around the world and to get U.S. radio stations through wifi that I couldn't get locally. They use to have this that you could search the world over via wifi. "Internet Radio (over 16,000 stations) and FM-RDS Waveband"...they no longer have the 16,000 radio stations that you could search. The reason that I bought this radio was because they had the 16,000 radio stations from all around the world that you could search. Contacting support was useless. If you're looking for a good Wifi Radio...this one isn't it. Look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this radio til issues are resolved!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio for several years, but recent changes to the website they use to manage stations for the radio have rendered it a rather expensive paperweight. Not technically savvy enough enough to explain it. Search all reviews and click "most recent" and you will see others talk about this. They're not being bitchy--they are correct. If I could get my money back (too late now) I would! A month ago I listened to it every day. Since then it keeps my papers firmly in place when the wind blows.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Nice Radio but several problems
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio now for 10 months. I started out really liking this radio with a lot of features and the 5 memory buttons make it easy to tune back to your favorite stations. Now all that changedl a few months ago. The radio would just randomly drop off the station I was listening to. The screen started freezing up and have flashing waves across it. The latest problem the audio is good and then stops, then starts. Adjusting the volume didn't change the volume. Its unfortunate because I really do like this radio!
customer_reviews.author: Techno Geek Guru

customer_reviews.title: Web portal has been restored!
customer_reviews.text: This is just to let all know that a web portal has been restored, so it is now possible to store your favorites online. The portal had earlier been discontinued, and the only fast way to select stations was to use the 5 preset buttons (not nearly enough), but now Sangean has worked out a new portal. Instructions appear on the radio screen when you go through the menu. I am happy with the radio again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to listen to music files on USB drives and internet radio without having my TV (Roku) and DVD player left on all the time. This unit satisfied both objectives, has a line out mini phone-plug socket which you connect to your receiver, old school RCA plug style. Having purchased, and returned, a Sangean digital FM tuner which could not pick up an FM station if it was at FM station; I was not surprised that the FM radio in this unit is also worthless. So if you are thinking about FM radio, go elsewhere. A 1970s vintage Proton tuner, like mine, would be my suggestion. Yamaha receiver tuner sections are about worthless also!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Unlike most wifi equipment, this radio is almost impossible ...
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most wifi equipment, this radio is almost impossible to connect to the network. I finally succeeded only to have it fail 4 days later. All retries failed as well. Customer support was not helpful and could have cared less. Do not buy this item unless you are a sophisticated computer tech.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Leighty

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only 5 days, then completely dead.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for only 5 days, then completely dead. Sangean operating instruction booklet or website does not provide any trouble shooting help. This is the only item I've purchased that didn't have at least some trouble shooting Q & A's in the instruction book. No customer blog, no obvious phone numbers to call directly for support. They do have a general main number however. Apparently, they really don't want to try and resolve issues over the phone. They just want us to return it to them for repairs. I'll be sending it to them for warranty repair. Hope the next one lasts more than 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Bob A.

customer_reviews.title: Quite a comprehensive radio at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well as an additional source to Internet Radio. Only problem I have is with the selection tuning buttons. Once set in memory, the 5 buttons then are used to selection each station that you have decided to store. I find that in order to selection a new station, that you have to be quite quick on selecting and releasing the button or else you will store a new station in place of the old. Also, the unit is quite heavy when the D-sized batteries are installed, but the batteries themselves last surprisingly long. The speaker has good sound and loudness. Overall, a great sounding unit!
customer_reviews.author: PackMan

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for places you can't get a radio signal
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we can't get a radio station in our shop due to concrete walls. I bough this for a neighbor business, that was using a laptop to get radio station music. We used it to get radio stations across the USA that we like to listen to via wifi and the internet. The possibilities are endless. If it streams, you can pick it up on this internet radio. It connected into our speaker system in our beauty shop. Worked great out of the box. Now we can easily listed to different radio stations by a push of a button, rather than using a laptop. Hghly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Video Doc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic FM / Internet Radio
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Sangean FM/Internet radio ! Its very easy to connect to your wifi. I can get stations throughout the United States and many other countries throughout the world. The sound is amazing! You can preset favorite stations. Its light and portable. The D cell rechargeable batteries are extra if you need them. I am very happy with this and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie K.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Portable Radio
customer_reviews.text: I have been very very pleased with his product. It has superb sound, despite the small speaker size. If you decide to install chargeable batteries, be advised that the battery compartment is extremely tight. The first set of 10000 mAh batteries I tried would not squeeze into the compartment. I exchanged them for the less powerful Eveready 2500 mAh rechargeables (cheaper and lighter) and had no fit problems.
customer_reviews.author: The Great Oz

customer_reviews.title: Good for my use.
customer_reviews.text: Took a little time learning the menu. Took more time to receive stations not available on Frontier Silicon but it can still be done. Sound is acceptable for a small portable radio. A bit heavy and no carry handle. Best to set it down and leave it. I leave the power plugged in so can't comment on battery life. I connected a Bluetooth Transmitter to the Line Out so can hear it in different rooms with Bluetooth Speakers.
customer_reviews.author: RustyB

customer_reviews.title: Plug pack is junk.
customer_reviews.text: While the radio is fine (I love the radio), the SMPS plug pack is complete garbage and has failed. Attempts to contact Sangean have gone unanswered. EDITED 10/26/17 They finally emailed me back weeks later and refused to honor their warranty. They said the plug pack doesn't have a warranty, even though their warranty explicitly states parts and labor.
customer_reviews.author: ballcock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program and use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little radio: easy to program and use anywhere there is Wifi. It has a good feature where it is possible to use my computer to download stations online and download them into the 'favourites' section of the radio. The display is clear and very readable. However, if the radio is placed close to my microwave, the wifi signal is temporarily cut off and I do not receive the station. It resumes playing again when the microwave is stopped. This is no different from a previous different make of radio I once had.
customer_reviews.author: Bert R

customer_reviews.title: No remote capability
customer_reviews.text: Product advertised as having a remote capability with the isangean app on ios. While the app exists, it is totally useless and doesn't make contact with the radio. There is absolutely no support from Sangean. Also, display disappears from radio in internet mode after a short period, even though audio still is functioning. Finally, FM radio reception is poor, with built-in antenna and there is no provision for a replacement antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis A. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic... until it isn't
customer_reviews.text: Loved this radio, Excellent sound, Dual Alarm, Thousands of stations, Robust, Works Perfectly... until it dies unexpectedly and won't connect to WIFI. Out of warranty so now it's a boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Good Radio with a Significant Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably-priced, easy-to-operate internet radio with decent sound. However, the battery compartment will not accept most NiMH rechargeable batteries because it is 1mm to 2mm too small. I have tried three different brands of "D" sized rechargeable batteries with the same result. I have not tried Alkaline cells. EDIT July 13, 2020: One brand of rechargeable NiMH "D" cells DOES fit this radio - Energizer batteries purchased from Amazon.com. The radio now operates as expected.
customer_reviews.author: SeaDog11

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than the Ocean, but still bot senior friendly
customer_reviews.text: I live where there is no radio signal. I need an internet radio that works and is easy for my elderly mom to use. So far this is the third i tried and best of those, but still leaves things to be desired. Its very hard to to put the rechargeable batteries, i doubt a senior could... my mother couldn't. I would expect the battery compartment to meet industry standards, hit be underszed from sangean. Disappointed over all in my expectations for this radio being a sangean after trying cheaper alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Scheduled to break?
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these so my wife can listen to Italian stations. She liked it so much I bought a second one for her for the kitchen. While the interface is terribly clunky she could make it work and listen to the stations she loved. However, several years after purchase both radios stopped working on the exact same day. Customer service said the boards had gone bad. So how could this happen to two radios on the exact same day several years after purchase? I suspected they learned a trick form Apple. I sent Email and wrote a physical letter to the company and asked them to explain this. No reply. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Ecker

customer_reviews.title: Best Portable Radio I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These wifi radios are something else. Best thing I've bought in a long time, because they can receive signals all over the house and can search for internet stations all over the world. Don't let the single speaker fool you, these things are plenty loud, you can hear one across the house when it's volume is set to about 20. These things are worth every dime and the best part is that they can pick up regular radio and can be run on normal batteries.
customer_reviews.author: TKG

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it works
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Jan 2018. WIFI started up just fine. WIFI died in April and now can do nothing to make it detect my service. All of my other WIFI devices work fine so I know it's not the WIFI. I generally never have set up issues for connectivity and I understand all of the set up options. I have tried WIZZARD thru Manual WPS etc. Too bad no help from Sangean other than mail it back OUT of 90 day warranty and pay to fix. No thanks. This one going to recycle and never to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: i've had this radio for over a year and listen to it every day. it's durable, picks up wifi very well and receives all the stations i like in the u.s. also picks up stations all over the world easily. it's easy to set up and has alot of other useful functions. i listen to alot of talk radio and it also picks up any genre of music you could imagine. i have really enjoyed this radio. it doesn't have sleep mode or remote but i don't miss that. i mostly listen to it at my desk at home. if you have wifi you can listen to anything anytime anywhere with clear quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: lcapton

customer_reviews.title: This is a excellent product very high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a excellent product very high quality, excellent sound and well thought out. This is the second one I have purchased as the first one ended up living in my workshop, set up easy website is straightforward and you can program favourite stations as many as you like, this will automatically be available on the Internet radio, if you have more than one device like I do favourites automatically appear on other devices if you want this to happen, very happy with this FM and Internet radio.
customer_reviews.author: Ian O.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the somewhat daunting owners manual put you off. This radio is highly intuitive. I literally had it up and running with 5 presets within 10 minutes of opening the box. All you need is a reliable internet connection, your password, and some careful reading of the first few pages of the manual, and I was listening to WQXR in New York and WFMT in Chicago clearly and with reasonable fidelity given the speaker size. Nicely designed and compact. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Douglass F. Rohrman

customer_reviews.title: The device works as advertised, we just bought the wrong product
customer_reviews.text: The device works as advertised and well made. The ergonomics and control layout combine for truly abysmal user experience. The button and knob functions are very counterintuitive, the display is small and very difficult to read from an angle. The 90 page(!) user manual is, well, special. This said, if one's use is such that interaction with the controls is unnecessary, the device works fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Helm

customer_reviews.title: Hope You Have Better Luck...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for this radio are difficult to interpret. It only connected to the internet about 50% of the time on the first try (could have been the pairing with our router). The instructions suggest to disconnect the power supply from the radio and not leave it connected long-term. However, whenever the AC power source is disconnected the clock requires resetting. Internet radios should be easy to use and understand. I'm trying another one.
customer_reviews.author: The Infinity Group

customer_reviews.title: Temperamental WiFi Device with Poor User Interface
customer_reviews.text: I use this device solely for Internet Radio and accessing my music collection on NAS. Very frustrating to use due to network time-outs and NAS UPnP access. (Other home streaming devices are much more reliable.) Its WiFi performance seems stunted. Overall, its user interface is not the friendliest. I’ve owned this device for over two years and always hopeful that a firmware update will improve its performance but not so far.
customer_reviews.author: LouB

customer_reviews.title: This Sangean is a well made radio with good feature. I was hoping however to listen to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a radio person and i know radios. This Sangean is a well made radio with good feature. I was hoping however to listen to many "real" radio stations, and this radio does not have the best search, and is missing many, many "real" local and live stations. Plus, one cannot search for a station by the call-sign (like "WABC" or "WCBS". Maybe Sangean should use the "Tune-In" chip instead of Reciva or which ever company/station aggregator it currently uses. For users that want to search for, find, and listen to "real" and live over-the-air station, get an internet radio that uses "Tune In". Thank you Sangean your products are good, but keep up the good work and improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The radio is fine although the instructions took me a while to get ...
customer_reviews.text: The radio is fine although the instructions took me a while to get through. One main point that should be emphasized is that it should be plugged in to program your WiFi connection as on batteries, the screen goes dark in around 5 seconds- easy to lose your place. What wasn't fine was either the A/C adaptor of the connector in the radio itself. The connector fit to the radio was so loose that it would not supply A/C to the radio therefor complicating the programming/use....I'm thinking why doesn't this work....the radio has batteries (now showing as low) and it's plugged in? I made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Radio Support is Down
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio for a while and I was satisfied with the service and the excellent features until May 7th, 2019. The Wifi Radio support website is being reconstructed. As a result, no setup is possible on the website. Nearly all my radio stations are gone. Despite their promise to add all reported missing stations within 48 hours, they haven't been able to do so. The "favorite" function has been disabled all together. Until the radio service is fixed (if ever) this unit is no longer worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Peterking

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an internet radio, look elsewhere. It was too late to return when the internet radio started to get unreliable. It's reception became very flaky, cutting in and out. Yesterday, turned it on and it told me that due to a change all my presets were erased. NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted (see update)
customer_reviews.text: Great little bedside clock/radio with good connectivity and sound. Loved it until 1 1/2 years later the amplifier circuit died (sound only faintly audible). And of course the 1 year warranty had expired. UPDATE, 12/17: Played around with it and got normal sound level in FM mode; switched back to Internet radio mode and sound was similarly normal. So the clever bugger fixed itself! Happy again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mclean

customer_reviews.title: Great, but do NOT drop the radio with batteries inside.
customer_reviews.text: One warning! Do NOT drop this radio with batteries in it. The batteries will bend the battery contacts when it hits the floor, and you'll have to take the radio apart to properly bend the contacts back. It's also really easy to pinch one of the white wires when you reassemble, which cuts the wire. Other than that, the radio has decent sound, has decent FM reception, can reach the WIFI hot spot with decent distance, and is a pretty solid piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing radio
customer_reviews.text: Sangean used to make great radios, this is not one of them. Refused to connect to my Wi-Fi router, the FM stations worked fine but there was no feeling of "enjoyment". Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amer S.

customer_reviews.title: After several months love this radio
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully designed. Solid high quality construction. Handy dial and lots of buttons and menu options that gets you to the action you need nicely. Excellent little color screen. Seems to have every desirable function such as retaining recently used stations. Very good sound quality. Pulls in weak Wi-Fi signal well. Surprisingly heavy with 4 chargeable D cells but runs fine without them.
customer_reviews.author: DixPix

customer_reviews.title: Solid Sangean
customer_reviews.text: Liked the first radio so much I ordered a second. Set up took about 5 minutes as another reviewer noted. Sound is really good and with the batteries in the unit, it feels really solid. I like the options of using regular batteries, rechargeable batteries or the ac plug that ships with the radio. Since I only use the internet radio, I can't comment on the radio reception. Internet radio sound is very good and there is a built in equalizer to tweak the sound. The radio does take about 30 seconds to boot up and I do have issues with signal which could be my router. I just move the radio. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, large variety of stations
customer_reviews.text: The sound and access to the vast music and other sources of music and other stations are great! Navigating the programming and search requires patience and ingenuity. No remote was included but there are lots of options. I haven't used the sleep mode, but am having time exploring the music of the world.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sims

customer_reviews.title: No 5Ghz WiFi connection Made
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to link with a 5 Ghz network, but it wouldn't. It was no improvement over the Logitech that I was replacing.
customer_reviews.author: cgilbert

customer_reviews.title: Best WiFi radio I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for $107. Great sound for a small speaker, but with a headset sounds like a big stereo. Radio stations sound like HD with equalizer turned up a bit.Really like the usb port. I can play my Coast to Coast radio shows. Wish it could record to usb so I didn't have to get up at midnight to record them. Hope they do that later. Mine has the monotone screen, even though it shows color in the picture. Probably why it was so cheaper. Shows color on my smart phone, so it's okay. Amplifier is high quality with highs and lows. No hiss or distortion at high volume.
customer_reviews.author: DYTRIPPER

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little internet radio. I had one a couple of years ago and was sorry I sold it. So far I am able to pick up stations all around the world with no issues. Sound quality is great and the smartphone app is seamless. I particularly like being able to put my favorite songs on a flash drive from my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not work anymore
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this radio --- As it turns out the radio is use a 3rd party the wi-fy radio database. It broke early in may 2019 --- I called their support and I am not sure if their solution was somewhere between evasive or incompetent I would first check with their website in the support section for this model At this point my radio is no better then a paper weight
customer_reviews.author: fpefpe

customer_reviews.title: Great radio and in a class by itself
customer_reviews.text: As has been discussed by other owners, there is a lag when using the radio tuner and some functions, but that aside this is simply a great radio. And honestly, for the money, it can't be beat. The tuner pulls in weak signals in my area, it can use regular D-cell or rechargeable batteries, it comes with an external power supply, and the Internet channel search capability is simply outstanding. This is a truly amazing radio.
customer_reviews.author: HAG

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are very difficult to insert & remove, otherwise a great radio!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this radio, with the exception of the really dumb battery compartment with stiff spring clips rather than springs to maintain battery contact tension. Batteries are extremely difficult to insert, and even harder to remove. If you only use the "wall wart", the radio is wonderful, but if you use the 4 "D" cells, you're in for frustration.
customer_reviews.author: DrDave

customer_reviews.title: Works well, needs more presets.
customer_reviews.text: This internet radio offers above average sound quality for such a small box, it has adequate range in my 2 story wood frame house even with my wi-fi router in the basement and the radio on the second floor. I do have 2 issues; the controls are not very intuitive and it really needs more preset buttons. With thousands of stations to choose from how could you possibly only put 5 presets on it, baffling! As far as the controls, the dial on the side seems to have to be turned the wrong direction to advance the menus and it is stiff and difficult to push. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Good radio for inside use
customer_reviews.text: Good radio for inside use. The wifi receiver needs a strong signal, so I can't use it just outside my house as I would wish without adding a range extender both to the back porch area and my front/workshop area. A bit better reception and I'd give it a 5, but all my other devices need no help in any location away from my home office (router location).
customer_reviews.author: Ronh

customer_reviews.title: If only...
customer_reviews.text: It had five more preset buttons, it'd be purrrfect! Otherwise, a great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Eino Grön

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality radio.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a city with spotty FM reception. However, the Sangean radio's FM receiver is extremely powerful and pulls in stations without needing to use the antenna in most cases. I absolutely love the access to the thousands of Internet stations and podcasts! The speaker has great sound. Having purchased several FM/AM radios that failed to pull in FM stations adequately, the Sangean exceeded my expectations in every way. I definitely recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Too much trouble
customer_reviews.text: The radio worked great for almost a year. After that time it would no longer connect to the Internet. I replaced it with another radio and frankly is just too hard to set up.
customer_reviews.author: HAROLD R GUNNIN JR

customer_reviews.title: Radio stopped working after three weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after three weeks. It loses power. The radio will play for about five minutes then just goes out. We thought it was rechargeable batteries but it does it when plugged in. Trying to contact company now but don't know if they will honor their product.
customer_reviews.author: sally messenger

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding radio for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality for a small radio. Does not sound like a cheap hollow plastic box. Streaming seems reliable. I use the iPad app to browse for new stations, then tap to play them instantly on the radio. Using 10,000mah NiMh D cells, it takes around 12hrs with the radio off to fully charge dead batteries. Line out is separate from the headphone jack, allowing the internal speaker to sound while using another speaker.
customer_reviews.author: The Horn

customer_reviews.title: If you like radio and have WiFi access BUY THIS TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: If you like radio of any genre then buy this. I live in a crummy area for decent radio but know I can listen to my favorite talks hosts, oldies, rock and even some stuff I never thought of. The setup is simple enough especially if you use the Frontier free website to pick station favorites. Tough little box. I bought rechargeable D cell batteries (1000mAH) Nickel Hydride to avoid buying disposable. This is basically a small computer so it consumes a chunk of power.
customer_reviews.author: R in Washington State

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best
customer_reviews.text: This internet radio is possibly the best on the market. It is easy to set up. Mobile and well made. This is not a light radio and is substantial in weight. i like it well enough to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Internet, FM, USB radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the these and they work great! Use these rechargeable "D" cell NiMh rechargeable batteries (4) in this:
customer_reviews.author: William D. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent internet radio with local FM capability - great sensitivity ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent internet radio with local FM capability - great sensitivity and selectivity. Portable, often used outside with small soundbar. Connects to wi-fi quickly and doesn't sit "buffering" the material ad nausea. Hooked to a Klipsch THX system for a garage radio that rocks (the neighborhood).
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Love it -- but if you haven't used a wifi ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it -- but if you haven't used a wifi radio or internet radio before -- will take some learning time. FOR A PORTABLE, WITH 4 D CELLS INSTALLED IT IS HEAVY AND THERE IS NO HANDLE OR EASY WAY TO PICK IT UP. Searched for a carrying case - and can't find one, therefore this will likely end up in one place in the house and stay there. NOT EASY TO GET IT TO HOOK TO YOUR WIFE NETWORK. THE WIZARD HAS NEVER WORKED BUT DO IT MANUALLY, ENTER YOUR WIFE NETWORK PASSWORD AND IT IS GOOD FOREVER.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tibbs

customer_reviews.title: Radio worked for 6 months, Sangean sent back the radio after repairs with the same problem - won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: This Wi-Fi radio worked great for 6 months. Then it would not turn on for more than a few seconds, and that was only if the power cord was pulled halfway out and jiggled. Would not turn on at all using battery power. Spent $15 shipping it to Sangean for warranty repair along with an $8 check they required. I got it back 20 days later and it still does not work. There was no work order or any explanation of what (if anything) they did to it to try to make the repair. Would not recommend buying one just because of their poor warranty work.
customer_reviews.author: gum115

customer_reviews.title: Best Portable ever...on/off button in bad placement.
customer_reviews.text: Great Radio..... Can connect to most every radio station in the world.. thru internet. Trouble is, you have to know all the languages... I stick to USA. Only trouble I had. The Green on/off button, is on the front of the radio, and it can get pressed by accident, while handling.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Canusee

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Displays FM RBDS Text
customer_reviews.text: We're an FM station and we bought this so our office staff can monitor our RBDS radio text we send out. It's the only desktop radio we found that displays almost all 64 characters of RBDS radio text at once with very little scrolling. It has a nice, attractive color LCD display. The FM tuner seems good and sensitive. It will also monitor our web stream as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: A true Global Radio .
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions on this the day I received it then put it back in the box . So today its what the hell turn the thing on . In 10 min max I had it figured out without opening the instructions . This thing blows my mind . It is so easy to search in just about any way you like . Be a global citizen and get past the local attitudes and tastes if you so desire.The sound quality is very good . This unit is heavy and well built .
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Take carefull concideration if concidering purchasing form this company.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in Mar return in June to have head phone jack repaired. Unit was repaired and works fine, however when the radio was returned to me it was covered in fingerprints with some grease substance that won't wipe off with normal house hold chemical. I contact the company who said they would replace it, It is now the middle of August with no replacement insight. Would not recommends this company or there products. I did try to contact them again and the email was returned as unknown
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Listen to many bands, great sound
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound from this single-speaker, portable device. Radio decodes RDS on FM channels to display extra info (where available). The radio is solid and a bit heavy, but still portable for around the house or outside. You can also look up available Internet radio stations from around the world in it's built-in directory. I have not attempted to use the USB/MP3 player function; some report this doesn't work well. Killer features: stream Internet radio via your secure WPA wifi network, recharges (rechargeable) batteries while in the device.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio, but sound quality could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact size, takes 4 D batteries (regular or rechargeable). Excellent WiFi reception and stability, so much better than Grace Audio Mondo that keeps disconnecting from wifi all the time. Good: excellent wifi, easy menu to navigate, portable, can take rechargeable batteries and recharge them, but you have to flip a little switch in the battery compartment. Not so good: sound quality is iffy because of one mediocre speaker, its not bassy and does not have any highs. Sangean could do a better job by adding a small twitter.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Brannigan

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it 🤗
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Sangean internet radio. I can sit for hours finding new radio stations all over the world. For the money it sounds great. I wish I bought it a long time ago. It's a great Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely as a bedside radio
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely as a bedside radio. Smaller than some similar internet radios. Has web based interface for loading podcasts as well, but could be easier to load podcasts onto favorites list. Would score higher except for software issue where radio crashes if podcast address has error. Requires you to do a hard reset. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, works great, with some issues.
customer_reviews.text: Battery compartment is so tight that rechargeable batteries may not fit. It is supposed to offer built in battery charging with rechargeables, IF you can get them installed.
customer_reviews.author: dwader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several internet radios and this is by far the best. This is the second of this model I have purchased. It is very easy to set up, has very simple station finding. One of the problems with internet radios seems to be that they keep dropping out. This does but comes back immediately unlike all the other models I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Boston John

customer_reviews.title: Great portable internet radio
customer_reviews.text: Great radio once you get used to the controls. Sound is excellent and internet station availabilty is exceptional. If you have a reliable internet connection, this is the best portable internet radio I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great little radio with all the buttons and whisles
customer_reviews.text: Good sounding radio easy to set up. I also have a Logitech Internet radio I use in my living room hooked up to my sound sys. Both are good radios and perform very well this WFR 28 is perfect for bed side listening. I am 66 and remember the radio drama from the 50s I was overseas with my military family and remember the AFN radio network broadcasting The Lone Ranger,Gunsmoke, the Great Gildersleeve, Jack Benny and more. With this radio you can find a lot of radio drama stations, music of all types you can't go wrong with this radio and the price is right
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M 149 Amazon

customer_reviews.title: The sound likes good and the reception is very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is my first internet radio. The sound likes good and the reception is very nice. One of the cons is the compartment for the battery. It is very difficult to insert the 4 X D size .. Another issue with my unit is with the display: I really don't know if is a problem with hardware or software: Sometimes the screen turned off when I am rotating the tuning button, but the radio reaming working. When I press any key the screen back again... I will try to reset the system to the factory and test it again;. But in overall the radio is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Valdocir Donizete

customer_reviews.title: ... friends who were visiting me from abroad fell in love with my radio
customer_reviews.text: My friends who were visiting me from abroad fell in love with my radio. They insisted on having one to take abroad even though their electricity voltage is 240V
customer_reviews.author: gagar

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Radio!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous radio. Easy set up, and the Frontier Silicon Radio service is phenomenal. There is nothing not to like about this radio. I bought rechargeable batteries, they are a little tricky getting them in, but eventually I figured it out. There is a switch (inside battery compartment) for regular batteries VS rechargeable. Make sure you switch that to the appropriate selection, based on battery type. But honestly, this is a fantastic radio, I am going to buy a second one. FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Moran

customer_reviews.title: every thing fine & all is very good
customer_reviews.text: Hello, Dear Sir / Madam! I have open this item & I have watched that, every thing fine & all is very good! It can also play in WIFI- BBC RADIO 1 & All BBC Radio. It has many music & entertainment channel And MJ Radio. I live in INDIA, City - KOLKATA / CALCUTTA, So, when I will go back for India.. so, then I will must use this RADIO, then I can 100% realise how much good this item :) ! Thank you very much :) ! REGARDS, INDRAJIT LAHA / LAW. indrajit_law@hotmail.com
customer_reviews.author: PRINCE INDRAJIT LAW / LAHA.

customer_reviews.title: This radio is great. I am a Ham Radio operator and wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: This radio is great. I am a Ham Radio operator and wanted something to replace my old hobby with and stay in touch with the rest of the world. This Internet Radio works perfectly and so far I had no problems whatsoever. Wish it would have a handle for easier transportation around the home and therefore only four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Udo

customer_reviews.title: not as many as grace
customer_reviews.text: more stations are available on other internet radios. stations associated with iheart and other stations are not available with this radio. sound on this particular one isn't good
customer_reviews.author: tpa813

customer_reviews.title: Great combination of traditional and new radio technologies
customer_reviews.text: A little flaky (occasionally requires a reboot) but the sound quality is excellent and it’s easy to set up and use. It’s great having access to almost unlimited online stations plus FM RDS. The web interface to add new favorite stations takes a little getting used to but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Limited presets and very! tight battery compartment.
customer_reviews.text: After three weeks satellite re-formatted and lost presets. Have yet to get battery situation right so must be plugged in all of the time. This is my third Sanjean product and the only one thst did not exceed expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Krensle

customer_reviews.title: Does not maintain connection
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 WiFi connected internet radios. This is the newer one. It does not keep the WiFi connection. My other radio (almost 9 years old has no problem - everyday wakes me up with an alarm). Tried resetting, and reentering connection. Then it would connect - only to loose it. Returning it
customer_reviews.author: Must Reeds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio after owning several Sangean shortwave receivers which gave me many years of service. Performance-wise I have no complaints, the sound is excellent for a small portable. The only gripe I have is they put the power button on front of the radio. I carry mine in my work bag and the radio gets turned on easily inside the bag. I fixed this by gluing a plastic ring around the button, but I wish the power button was on top.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Heinonen

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like this radio
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this radio. It is intuitive and easy to learn how to use. I have already linked a favorite streaming station on Frontier Silicon WiFi that wasnt already on there and that worked great. The only problem Ive had is the rechargable batteries I bought apparently didnt charge and yes I flipped the little switch in the battery compartment, but the batteries I got may have been bad so not holding that against the radio in this review.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMike

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty cool. Not as easy to hook up to other Wi-Fi sources as I thought it would be (like at work we have free wifi, so there is no password just an "agreement" thing to click and you can't do that on here). Great sound though and music from all over, even Africa (I'm in the US) was coming in when I had good internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get wifi stations!
customer_reviews.text: Before this radio, I was not taking advantage of all the wonderful content wifi can offer. This radio brings it all right to you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Sangean WFR-28 radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is amazing. The instructions to setup were easy to understand and I had no problems connecting it to my home Wifi network. You get clear reception on all the stations and with no static. I have now had my Sangean WiFi radio for 2 days now and it works perfectly. It does everything it was advertised to do. As always, I am pleased with this purchase from Amazon. This is an amazing radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the radio but it will not keep WiFi in storage
customer_reviews.text: Every time I use the radio I have to reset the WiFi. This gets really old when its bed time and you have to mess with the radio to get a station. I was out of the country for a while and missed the return date. Don't but if you want a reliable radio.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this radio. I had no problems setting it up or operating it. But then after just two years, it died. If it were not for the short life span, I would have given it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie R. Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Really good internet radioThis
customer_reviews.text: This is my third internet radio and it is by far the most usable one It easily gets and holds the desired station. For a small radio it has agreeable sound. Only mild complaint is that it has too few presets.
customer_reviews.author: ian blackstone

customer_reviews.title: Happy about it
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit, got it for my wife and wanted to set it up while she was doing an errant ( package came when she was already out ). Without reading the manual ( just skimming it ), I had everything done in minutes. Very simple, clear, logical. Runs on included power supply (brick) and on batteries ( 4x D-Type ). Has an BUILT-IN Recharger !!! ( I ordered the NiMH ) Only ( minor ) drawback is the limited number of Preset Stations ( 5 for Internet ), which in my case was all we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Parkuhr

customer_reviews.title: Sangean is Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Standard broadcast radio reception in our area is not great, so this internet radio is just perfect. I can get the local NZ stations I want, plus so much more, such as BBC and other major international stations. It has to connect to WiFi network and speaker produces good quality sounds. Overall build quality also seems excellent. Buyers need to be a aware that if they want DAB, they need to get the 28C model. However here in NZ we don't have DAB so not an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... we distill is cinderblock so it doesn't get any good radio reception for my guys that are working
customer_reviews.text: I own a distillery and the building where we distill is cinderblock so it doesn't get any good radio reception for my guys that are working. I do have a wifi set up in the building so this has worked great for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound
customer_reviews.text: I use this radio in my kitchen and listen to Greek and UK radio stations, it works great easy to setup if you are reasonably technical. Doesn't seem to support a couple of podcasts that I want but that's ok. Nice to have a stand alone radio, would be good if you could update the software to use Apple Music, just has Spotify, so would be great if you have a Spotify account.
customer_reviews.author: Costas

customer_reviews.title: My Wife likes to push buttons
customer_reviews.text: Our needs are simple - a couple of German station, a couple of Italian - NPR - WQXR - it's perfect for u s
customer_reviews.author: Martin Glynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Internet Radio.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Internet radio, had lots of fun programming in stations from around the country and world. Nothing not to like about this radio. Get the rechargeable batteries too if you want to take it around or near the house.
customer_reviews.author: spongella

customer_reviews.title: Great, I haven't found a better one
customer_reviews.text: The best Wi-Fi radio so far. Better than the larger Sandgean, the one with CD player and the one without CD player. I have both. I'm looking for a tabletop Internet radio, and an FM, CD player combination with good sound quality. Not Bose.
customer_reviews.author: dan w carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Falls asleep on duty
customer_reviews.text: Love the build, price, performance. Only fly in the ointment for me is that it keeps putting itself to sleep. There’s no control for that. I use it in a distributed audio system.
customer_reviews.author: Derailious Thatchett

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to get my money back
customer_reviews.text: In my estimation, internet radio is very unreliable. One day your saved station comes in bright and clear, and the next day you hear nothing at all. Don't know if it's the radio, or the internet? You may receive strong reception for several days...then nothing for days at a time. Either way, I'd like to get my money back. The tech. support at Sangean is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rossi

customer_reviews.title: great wifi radio
customer_reviews.text: It will automatically search the radio stations after the first wifi internet connection. The sound is good and clear, and even booming sound. And its monitor says the current time and radio station name. It will also automatically open the station when you listened last time. But it's a little bit bulky if you want it put in your pocket, only suitable for your table.
customer_reviews.author: wenghuizhang

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this radio. It's worth it, comfortable, portable and practical. Pity, it has few quick preset buttons (only 5). Narrow battery compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Superb gadget overall
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this internet radio, except one thing: Every time I set the time zone to my zone it reverts back to one hour ahead by itself after a while! I know its a small problem, but I can't understand the reason for it. Otherwise I am thoroughly enjoying radio stations from Europe and elsewhere in perfect quality sound :)
customer_reviews.author: Amir Rahim

customer_reviews.title: No AM static
customer_reviews.text: Best radio I’ve ever owned. Reception is fabulous and the thousands of stations I can receive is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: anthony zuccarini

customer_reviews.title: worst user manuel
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst user manual ever that comes with this device. I almost sent it back to amazon because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Martin

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, and even poorer tech support
customer_reviews.text: My first one had a problem with the view screen, so dim could not be read. Returned for replacement, and that one refuses to connect with internet. I called Sangean USA in California and got no help at all. No more Sangean for me.... Sorry, but even one star is more than they deserve ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Beebe Jr

product_meta.title: Sangean WFR-28 Internet Radio / FM-RBDS / USB / Network Music Player Digital Receiver with Color Display
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe Sangean Ultra-Compact Portable Wi-Fi Internet Radio (WFR-28) is a combination Internet radio and audio media streaming device that is fully portable. With it users can listen to 15,000+ Internet radio stations as well as to your regular FM Band with RBDS. This device runs on either rechargeable or regular dry-cell batteries as well as the included AC adapter.
feature_bullets: Internet Radio, FM-RBDS/ USB/ Network Music Player Digital Radio (USB MP3 playback and WMA compatible) with over 20, 000 Internet channels and podcast available.

Control the radio with the free undok remote control app, compatible with iOS and Android devices. The app allows selection of internet radio stations and control of media for UPnP/DLNA music streaming from a local computer, server or NAS device, as well as control of FM radio and other functions. Undok is also compatible with Spotify connect so you can play your music directly from your Spotify app
Easy to read LCD display with backlight and 10 station presets (5 Internet, 5 FM)
Stereo/ mono switch, rotary treble and bass controls, loudness on/ off
Built-in battery charger with charging LED indicator, aux-in and stereo headphone output

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars608 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
